alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 03 at 7:22PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Indiana, including the following county, Jefferson. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 720 PM EDT, emergency management reported flooding in extreme Eastern Jefferson County due to thunderstorms from earlier this afternoon. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Remember, a Flash Flood Warning is also in effect for portions of Jefferson County until 845 PM EDT. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Madison, China, Canaan, Manville, Belleview, Bryantsburg, Barbersville, Ringwald and North Madison. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
